meaning: Āshobhanā stands for ‘āsamantāt Shobhana’i.e. the state of incomparable bliss (Brahmānandā).
commentary:
She enjoys this supreme bliss and bestows such bliss upon Her devotees.

The name ‘Shobhana’ recurs thrice in this Sahasranama. The first is inSubruh Shobhana suranayika. At this point She bestows worldly bliss (loukika ananda). Here She bestows the Supreme bliss i.e. the bliss enjoyed by Brahma.
